title: Internal compiler error: Failed to get crate data for crate18

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code repo: git@github.com:second-state/SewUp.git hash: 9a19457f65a8195ecd40a8bc11540d364425acac ### Meta [full log](https://github.com/second-state/SewUp/runs/2582317015) `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.52.0 (88f19c6da 2021-05-03) binary: rustc commit-hash: 88f19c6dab716c6281af7602e30f413e809c5974 commit-date: 2021-05-03 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.52.0 LLVM version: 12.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.52.1 (9bc8c42bb 2021-05-09) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `thiserror` ```
Backtrace
